intro: Stenogyne rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf stenogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. It has small, elliptical fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Stenogyne rotundifolia is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and introduced pests.
